taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek mythological Dirce, wife of Lycus who was transformed by Dionysus into a fountain]

bio:treatment.description: Shrubs, deciduous, to 3 m. Stems erect, branched, appearing jointed, woody, sericeous or or (3–)4-lobed; petals (absent in D. palustris), included, minute, forming ring at base of staminal filaments; stamens 8, exserted, inserted within calyx; style exserted, elongate; stigma punctiform. Fruits drupaceous, yellow, yellow-green, or green, fleshy, oil-rich, hypanthium not persistent.
bio:treatment.discussion: Dirca mexicana G. L. Nesom & Mayfield is known from Tamaulipas, Mexico.
